sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: Given a circle with a radius of 8cm, find the area of the sector formed by a central angle of 60 degrees. Round your answer to the nearest whole number.
message_2:
To find the area of the sector, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle / 360) × π × radius²

In this case, the central angle is 60 degrees and the radius is 8 cm.

Area of sector = (60 / 360) × π × 8²
Area of sector = (1/6) × π × 64
Area of sector = (64π) / 6

Now, we can approximate the value of π as 3.14.

Area of sector ≈ (64 × 3.14) / 6
Area of sector ≈ 200.96 / 6
Area of sector ≈ 33.49

Rounding to the nearest whole number, the area of the sector is approximately 33 square centimeters.
